meanings.definition: The process of redesigning and restructuring a system or organization for improved efficiency.
meanings.sent1: The reengineering of the company's workflow led to increased productivity.
meanings.sent2: The reengineering of the school's curriculum resulted in better student performance.
meanings.sent3: After the reengineering of the office layout, everyone kept bumping into each other!
meanings.sent4: The reengineering of the team dynamics was like rearranging pieces of a puzzle.
meanings.sent5: The reengineering of the supply chain was a game-changer for the business.

meanings.definition: To restructure or redesign a system or organization for improved efficiency.
meanings.sent1: They decided to reengineer the production process to reduce costs.
meanings.sent2: She plans to reengineer the marketing strategy to reach a wider audience.
meanings.sent3: He jokingly said he would reengineer his morning routine to become a morning person.
meanings.sent4: The team leader reengineered the project timeline to meet the deadline.
meanings.sent5: Reengineering the website layout made it more user-friendly.
